intro: Sorbus hornadensis, commonly known as the Hornád rowan, is a species of flowering plant in the rose family. It is native to the Carpathian Basin and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and red berries. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in forested areas. It has simple, alternate leaves and produces fruit that is edible for birds and other wildlife. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
